title: How to Play Every Version of the ‘Lemonade Crunchy Ice’ Game

steps.content: Lemonade (Up Down Clap) (Triple Clap) Crunchy ice (Up Down Clap) (Triple Clap) Sip it once (Up Down Clap) (Triple Clap) Sip it twice (Up Down Clap) (Triple Clap) Lemonade (Up Down Clap) Crunchy ice (Up Down Clap) Made it once (Up Down Clap) Made it twice (Up Down Clap) Turn around (Turn around) Touch the ground (Touch the ground) Push your brother out of town! (Shoving motion) And stomp! (Jump) [1] X Research source
Lemonade Crunchy ice Sip it once Sip it twice Lemonade Crunchy ice Sip it once Sip it twice Turn around Touch the ground Touch your nose Make a pose And FREEZE. [2] X Research source
Lemonade Crunchy ice Beat it once Beat it twice Lemonade Crunchy ice Beat it once Beat it twice Turn around Touch the ground Kick your boyfriend out of town And FREEZE. [3] X Research source

Lemonade Crunchy ice Sip it once Sip it twice Lemonade Crunchy ice Sip it once Sip it twice Turn around Touch the ground Kick your boyfriend out of town Freeze like American cheese. [4] X Research source
Lemonade Iced tea Coca Cola Pep-si Lemonade Iced tea Coca Cola Pep-si Drink ‘em up Chug ‘em down Kick Dr. Pepper out of town. [5] X Research source

steps.title: Pair up with another player and sit or stand face-to-face.
steps.content: Pair up with another player and sit or stand face-to-face. This clapping game is usually played one-on-one. You could stand face-to-face with a partner or sit with multiple friends in a big circle and play with the person to your right. [6] X Research source

steps.title: Do an “Up Down Clap” to mark time while you chant the lyrics.
steps.content: Do an “Up Down Clap” to mark time while you chant the lyrics. To do the “Up Down Clap,” raise your left hand while keeping your palm face down. At the same time, lower your right hand with the palm face up. Have your partner do the same. Then, clap your hands against your partner’s by simultaneously bringing down your left hands and bringing up your right hands until both of your hands meet. Then, reverse hands and clap the other way (starting with the right hands up high and the left hands down low). [7] X Research source The “Up Down Clap” is used when reciting each line of the “Lemonade Crunchy Ice” lyrics.

steps.title: Perform a “Triple Clap” between lyrics in the first verse.
steps.content: Perform a “Triple Clap” between lyrics in the first verse. This one’s easy—just clap your own hands together three times. The “Triple Clap” is done only in the first verse—both players triple clap between each line of the lyrics. [8] X Research source

steps.title: Sing the first verse of the song and alternate “Up Down” and “Triple” claps.
steps.content: Sing the first verse of the song and alternate “Up Down” and “Triple” claps. The first verse of the song goes: Lemonade / Crunchy ice / Sip it once / Sip it twice . As you sing in a rhythm, do the “Up Down Clap” on each line and the “Triple Clap” in between each line. [9] X Research source

steps.title: Sing the second verse of the song without any “Triple Claps.”
steps.content: Sing the second verse of the song without any “Triple Claps.” The second verse of the song goes: Lemonade / Crunchy ice / Made it once / Made it twice . This verse is sung in a slightly quicker rhythm. So, you can skip the “Triple Clap” entirely. Just do the “Up Down Clap” on each line with no breaks in between. [10] X Research source

steps.title: Sing and perform the actions stated in the final four lyrics of the song.
steps.content: Sing and perform the actions stated in the final four lyrics of the song. The last part of the game depends on which version of the lyrics you use. The standard variation of the song finishes with “ Turn around / Touch the ground / Push your brother out of town / And stomp. ” On “turn around,” spin around in a circle. On “touch the ground,” touch the ground. On “push your brother out of town,” make a shoving motion with your hands. On “stomp,” jump! Switch up your actions or gestures if you’re using a variation on the lyrics. We’ve included some of the different lyrics and gestures below, but you can see the full lyrics for each version here . “Kick your boyfriend out of town” = Make a kicking motion. “Kick Dr. Pepper out of town” = Make a kicking motion. “Touch your nose” = Touch your nose. “Make a pose” = Strike any funny or silly pose. “And freeze” = Freeze (and don’t move!). “Freeze like American cheese” = Freeze (and don’t move!).

steps.title: If your version ends on “freeze,” try not to move afterward.
steps.content: If your version ends on “freeze,” try not to move afterward. In some variations of the song, the last word in the lyrics is “freeze.” Players are meant to strike a pose and not move from that position. The first player to move is the loser! [11] X Research source

“Lemonade Crunchy Ice” is guaranteed to provide hours of fun, but you’ll probably want to play some more nursery tunes and hand-clapping games afterward!
